workflow.name: Automate Resume Analysis & Candidate Screening with JotForm, Azure OCR, GPT-4.1, Zoho CRM
workflow.description:
## Who‚Äôs It For
This workflow is ideal for HR professionals, recruiters, and small businesses looking to streamline resume screening with AI-powered analysis and CRM integration.

## What It Does
This template automates resume processing by:
- Capturing resume submissions (name, email, PDF) via JotForm.
- Converting PDFs to images using PDF.co API.
- Extracting text with Azure Vision OCR.
- Analyzing resumes with GPT-4.1 for strengths, improvements, and a score (1‚Äì100).
- Storing submission data in PostgreSQL.
- Adding high-scoring resumes (>85) to Zoho CRM and sending congratulatory emails.
- Sending feedback emails for lower-scoring resumes.

## How to Set Up
1. **Configure JotForm Trigger**: Add your JotForm API key and form ID (e.g., 252434958811059).
2. **Set Up PostgreSQL**: Create a `resume` table with columns: `id` (SERIAL PRIMARY KEY), `given_name` (VARCHAR), `given_email` (VARCHAR), `resume_loc` (VARCHAR).
3. **Add Credentials**: Store API keys for PDF.co, Azure Vision OCR, OpenAI, Zoho CRM, and Gmail in n8n‚Äôs credential system.
4. **Test the Workflow**: Submit a test resume via JotForm and verify data flow through each node.

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Accounts with JotForm, PDF.co, Azure Vision, OpenAI, Zoho CRM, and Gmail.
- PostgreSQL database.

## How to Customize
- Adjust the GPT-4.1 prompt for specific job roles.
- Modify the score threshold (currently 85) in the "if score > 58?" node.
- Update email templates for personalized messaging.

## PostgreSQL Table Structure
> Node to create table included in workflow.

parameters.content: ## Convert PDF to JPG (PDF.co API). Extract text via Azure OCR. Check status and retry if needed.

parameters.name: Resume Analyzer 101
parameters.description: =Assistant to Analyze resume and give feedback
parameters.instructions:
=You are a professional career coach and HR expert with 10+ years of experience in recruitment and resume review. 
You help users improve their resumes by providing clear, structured, and helpful feedback.

You will receive the extracted text of a resume. 
Analyze it carefully and provide feedback in the following structured format:

---

**Overall Impression**
Briefly summarize how well this resume presents the candidate overall.

**Strengths**
List 3‚Äì5 things that are good about this resume (e.g., clarity, strong skills, measurable achievements, formatting).

**Areas for Improvement**
List 3‚Äì5 specific improvements the user can make (e.g., weak summary, missing keywords, lack of achievements, too long, inconsistent formatting).

**Keyword & Skills Analysis**
Identify relevant skills, tools, and keywords that appear in the text.
If it‚Äôs missing important ones for the likely job type, suggest which to add.

**Professional Summary (Optional Rewrite)**
If a summary section is missing or weak, write a short, improved professional summary (2‚Äì3 sentences).

**score**
Add strict score on resume between 1 and 100 
---

Keep the tone positive and constructive. 
Make the feedback easy for a non-technical person to understand.
Do not restate the entire resume text in your output.

parameters.content:
## JotForm 
Captures resume submissions (name, email, PDF URL). Stores data in PostgreSQL `resume` table.

## postgress
store all submissions in postgress
## Analyze resume text (OpenAI). Extract strengths, improvements, score. If score > 85: add to Zoho CRM, send congratulatory email. Else: send feedback email.

attributes.name: good_side
attributes.description:
=extract what is good in resume from analyzed data
make it short and use bulletpoints

attributes.name: to_improve
attributes.description:
=extract what to improve in resume from analyzed data
make it short and use bulletpoints

attributes.name: Score
attributes.description: score of resume only score not out of 100 or /100

parameters.subject: Resume Analyzed Results
Resume Analyzed Results

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
